job_title: Creative Director in New Orleans, LA
pros: You get to make your own schedule and the faculty are really nice and understanding.
cons: There is quite a lot to do and manage, and because all of the staff are students, sometimes coworkers can fall behind and this job could require you to do a lot of the work.

review_title: Nice place to work if you have more than one source of income
job_title: Executive Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Staff are very hard working, professional, and take a sincere interest in the mission at Loyola.
cons: Horrible pay and retirement package, no opportunity for staff to advance.

review_title: Great colleagues, not so great pay.
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in New Orleans, LA
pros: I've worked here for a while. I love my colleagues. I generally enjoy teaching the students. They tend to be more interactive than R1 schools. The research and scholarship is solid for a teaching focused school.
cons: There has been poor management of financial in the past leading to job security issues. Also, wage stagnation. Also, post COVID-19, a lot of the facilities have gotten worse with less clean up.

job_title: Executive Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Incredible work environment, with great flexibility and awesome coworkers
cons: Staff are underpaid relative to peers and expected to do more with fewer resources as the university attempts to figure out how to scale operations

job_title: Summer Conference Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: - Kind staff - On campus
cons: - Low pay - Immature coworkers - Unequal treatment

job_title: Lifeguard in New Orleans, LA
pros: They don't ask you to really lifeguard, nice facility.
cons: Pay is 7.25$ which is so low for a job you need a certification for.

job_title: Marketing Coordinator in New Orleans, LA
pros: Great people, mission, and flexible day-to-day schedule
cons: Overworked and underpaid, as is custom in any higher education institution

job_title: Senior Technical Advisor in New Orleans, LA
pros: The community of  staff are fantastic to work alongside. The work is meaningful. Employees have the opportunity to be a part of new academic initiatives. So, there is room for innovation and creativity. Excellent number of vacation day benefits and tuition free opportunities for employees and their immediate family members as well as health care coverage.
cons: Many staff are experiencing burnout as a result of multiple initiatives made by higher administration. Staff are often expected to work heavy workloads without compensation or salary increases and many have not experienced salary increases over a significant number of years. Stagnation of salary increases, low contribution to retirement, and lack of work/life balance can make working here very difficult.

job_title: Senior Admissions Counselor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Great benefits, university holiday calendar allowed for generous time off in December. Tuition benefits were a plus.
cons: The travel requirement for admissions can be brutal

job_title: Professor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Students, New Orleans, autonomy, colleagues are great
cons: Salary, benefits, too little emphasis on correcting issues

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Flexible work environment (hybrid/work from home options in most departments)
cons: Everything is disorganized all the time, no exceptions.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Loyola is incredibly community-based. People care about each other. People are willing to educate others whether that be inside or outside of the classroom.
cons: The community can at times be too accomodating to some and not accomodating to others. The university tries to find an easy way out of most situations. The "don't work too hard" environment of New Orleans definitely exists on this campus.

job_title: Career Coach in New Orleans, LA
pros: good benefits, tuition remission, and friendly environment
cons: base pay is lower than most other institutions

review_title: Nice campus and community/ non equitable salaries
job_title: Office Manager in New Orleans, LA
pros:
Nice work environment, students, faculty and staff are great to work with.
Nice campus, good opportunities for extra curricular activities.
Same Time off for Holidays most elementary schools and high schools get off-good for parents. 2 weeks paid Holiday Pay.
Flexible schedule available
cons:
Low pay, no pay increases in over 7 years, retirement contributions cut,
Not enough faculty and staff to student diversity ratio. The Faculty and Staff do not represent the diverse student body.
Paid parking

review_title: Poor University Administration Destroying Previously Excellent Workplace.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA
pros: Large amounts of paid time off.
cons:
Low pay.
Untenable and unsustainable work loads that continue to increase despite stagnant and sometimes decreased pay.
Very little advancement opportunities.
Poor leadership.
Lack of support from university administration.
Total lack of transparency from university administration.
Unethical business practices.
Huge lay-offs performed poorly and immorally.
Poor-quality Human Resources department that seems unable to keep up with the needs of the employees.
Extremely expensive on-site food and supplies.
Raising the price of services such as healthcare and childcare, despite stagnant and falling wages.

review_title: Working for a failing institution/ 90% acceptance rate
job_title: Administrative Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: Most of the people who work here are pleasant and friendly. There is some commitment to Christian values. It has the slow and easy appeal of a New Orleans job. Lots of time off.
cons: The university is contracting, so most jobs are dead-end jobs. There haven't been even cost of living raises in years. The financial woes are based on unaccountable managers (vice presidents, vice provosts, etc.) working in secret, lining their pockets, and blaming the economy. You should see the catering! And how much they spend on travel, hotels for conferences, and lavish dinners in New Orleans! There is no internal promotion system. Instead, multiple administrators have been explicit that Loyola operates a "patronage system." I've been told to find someone with authority and convince them (through sucking up) to create a position for me.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA
pros: Student, Staff, Work Life Balance, Support. Leadership
cons: Pay, Retirement, Parking, nothing else

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA
pros: The students are great, it is a beautiful campus, and I love my peers. It is a job I genuinely enjoy going to until I need to work with someone above the department level.
cons: The upper management is terrible. No leadership ability and we are always in financial straights. I worry that the priority isn't on academics or if it is, there is a gap in judgment. There is very limited opportunity to grow and pay is not reasonable for the city in which we reside.

review_title: theatre dept box office, psych dept actor-client program, and Maroon newspaper; the 1st was the best job I've ever had.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA

- flexible scheduling

- great resume builder

job_title: General Manager in Grand Prairie, TX
pros: Great opportunity for personal and continuous development. Worked with a team dedicated to the  growth and success  of all the students at the university. Was able to meet and exceed the client expectations in upholding the mission and values of the university as well as meet, manage the budgetary goals of the department. Measurable growth was met in finance, human resource recruitment and development and well as customer satisfaction.
cons: Hurricane seasons were more demanding in ensuring safety and preparedness across campus.

review_title: Convenient schedules around your class times.
job_title: Tutor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Sign up for the times you are available to work and for how long. The people you tutor are based on the classes you have or are currently taking. They work around your schedule.
cons: Some of the students that come in for help are looking for handouts on their homework rather than learning, but that is not the fault of the school.

review_title: Good way to start getting legal experience
job_title: Research Assistant in New Orleans, LA
pros: You work in the same environment where you go to school.  I was able to be a research assistant to a professor so you get to learn while you work. They also are pretty sensitive to your class schedule so juggling work vs. school isn't a challenge.
cons: No cons. I didn't run into any issues as a research assistant.

review_title: Well meaning, Great mission and students, poorly run in the past
job_title: Assistant Professor in New Orleans, LA
pros: The students are some of the kindest and supportive I have worked with.  Peers are supportive

job_title: Assistant Professor in New Orleans, LA
pros: The faculty and staff are really nice, the students are caring and the campus is beautiful

job_title: Senior Resident Assistant in New Orleans, LA

cons: The only downside of this job was it felt like at all times on campus I was looked at as being an RA, and not an individual. But that doesn't bother me much.
